content.description: The Overhang 5.7- Starts below a 2 foot block with a finger crack and then climbs up and left on good holds through a small overhang to a well placed bolt at the mantel crux from there climb up and slightly right to the anchors.
content.location: This climb is located about 15 feet to the right of Always Saturday and just to the left of the Pit.  This route starts just 5 feet to the right of the old 5.3 Overhangs Route that was forever changed due to rock fall.

content.description: Start 10’ to the left of the sport route OBSESSION where there is a finger pocket literally inside the drillmark. Climb using the finger pocket and to get to Broadway Ledge, 15 ft.
content.protection: Set up a Top Rope with gear above Broadway Ledge.

content.description: Originally it was a top rope route throughout the 80's that saw two additions of bolts by the FFA, the first to open the lower section in the 90s to open it as a mixed route and then the second to make the route more user friendly.  The route starts 12-13 drillmarks (60 feet) to the left of 'The Pit', in front of the lower quarried wall between the 3rd and 4th drillmarks from the wall's left end. Climb the flake between the two drillmarks to get to Broadway Ledge, 15 ft.
Start in the shallow left facing inside corner to the left of the Pit, climb the left facing inside corner.
content.location: Left of the pit but right of Always Saturday. Always Saturday is the last bolted line on the Front Wall.
Located between Boulder Problem and Beach Party

content.description: Easy Does It 5.5 - Is a great addition to Logtown Quarries and a good warm up. This route climbs a short easy slab section with big holds and great protection to a high step and mantel at the crux and finishes with easy climbing to the anchors.
content.location: This climb is just to the right of "Bugs Bunny" and just to the left of the "Ryser Route" located on the Front wall section of the "Big Cliff" area of Logtown Quarry

content.description: Start between the 1st and 2nd drillmarks to the right of the arete. Climb the right side of the arete and flake on the right, mantle up to Broadway Ledge.
content.protection: 2 bolts, side by side, and fixed anchor (shared with Nightmare wall climbs)
content.location:
Leftmost climb on the front wall, and the first climb right of the Right Main Wall. 

 Scramble up the right for easy TR access. Either reach down from Broadway Ledge to set up a Top Rope or use one of the anchors as a bolt and climb to Broadway Ledge and use anchors on Nightmare Right Side.

content.description: Start between the 4th and 5th drill marks near a nice little pocket climb straight up to  ring anchors on right going over a slight roof, or go left and follow 3 bolts to another set of ring anchors climbing up a small arete. The anchors are about 6’ left of last bolt. The roof and arete are both cruxes, the arete has small foot holds but a good ledge to hold on.
content.protection: Straight: 3 bolts, ring anchors Left: 4 bolts, ring anchors

content.description: Start at the flake between 7th and 8th drill marks to the left of the pit. Climb the flake up to the big ledge. Continue straight up to ring bolts.  Route is well protected with good stances for clipping.  Crux is the start on the flake, smear and stem off drill grooves to reach ledge and mantle up.

Start to the left of the pit and its the second bolted route. under a light band of rock, climb straight up following bolts. First crux is getting to Broadway Ledge. Second crux is the blank face about mid way, small footholds and hands on a ledge to match on, power up to reach a good handhold and finish route. Note: 2001 Guidebook has it rated as a 5.6. Over the winter (2014/15) a block sluffed off and eliminated a foothold making the crux harder.
content.location: Second bolted line to left of pit.

content.description: Climbs up a few good holds to a long reach to a good crimp at the base of the drill line in a obvious corner / book, From this point pull you feet up high to a good ledge and find a few good crimps on both sides of the small corner / book. Many options from this point right a little, left a little or straight up all lead to a mantel with great protection and easy climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Located on the Front Wall of the big cliff just to the right of Beach Party and just to the left of Husker Do. First obvious drill mark above and right of Broadway Ledge and last bolted line on The Front Wall.

content.description: Climb over several overhanging blocks and the block filled top section. CAUTION: Loose rock high on the cliff here as well as a hornet's nest.
content.protection: TR, not recommended due to the loose rock at the top of the cliff
content.location: Just right of the sport route Easy Does It.

content.description: A Little Something 5.9- Starts right off the ground with a solid jug in the lip of the drill line and follows a few thin moves to a two finger pocket in the drill line and a high step and throw to the ledge. once to the ledge easy climbing to the ring anchors.
content.location: A Little Something is located on the front wall to the left of Block Party as shown in the photograph.

content.description: Shady area like most of Logtown, sandstone, good rock to the anchors on all routes, few loose blocks here and there, rotten above anchors. Lots of bolts great place to learn to lead sport and improve.
